abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column explores prosecution's arguments in State Supreme Court trial of Johnny Hincapie, who is accused of helping to murder tourist Brian Watkins in 1990; Hincapie and his lawyers say they have new evidence to support claim that Hincapie's confession to murder was coerced.
lead_paragraph: Johnny Hincapie, who says he was wrongly convicted of murder in the killing of Utah tourist Brian Watkins in 1990, faced tough questioning at a hearing on Thursday.

headline.main: In Trip to Past, a False Confession Claim Meets Skepticism of Another Sort
headline.print_headline: In Trip to Past, a False Confession Claim Meets Skepticism of Another Sort

snippet: Johnny Hincapie, who says he was wrongly convicted of murder in the killing of Utah tourist Brian Watkins in 1990, faced tough questioning at a hearing on Thursday.
